title: Leonard Constance
text:
Leonard "Len" Constance (2 November 1922 – October 1990) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>ed rugby league in the 1950s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Hampshire%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Hampshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Newport%20RFC">Newport RFC</a>, <a href="Bristol%20Bears">Bristol</a>, <a href="Portsmouth%20Rugby%20Football%20Club">Portsmouth</a>, <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> and <a href="Combined%20Services">Combined Services</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Fly-half">fly-half</a>, i.e. number 10, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> (<a href="List%20of%20St%20Helens%20R.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 653</a>), <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wigan%20Warriors%20players">Heritage № 532</a>), and <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 603</a>), as a , or , i.e. number 3 or 4, or 6, and coached club level rugby league (RL) at <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a>.
Background.
Len Constance's birth was registered in <a href="Pontypool">Pontypool</a> district, Wales, he was a Lieutenant in the <a href="Royal%20Naval%20Reserve">Royal Naval Volunteer Reserve</a>, and he died aged in Wales.
Playing career.
International honours.
Len Constance won 3 caps for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) in 1948–1951 while at St. Helens, and Dewsbury.
County League appearances.
Len Constance played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s victory in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a>.
Notable tour matches.
Len Constance played , and scored a <a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a> in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 8–15 defeat by <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 3 November 1951.
Club career.
On Thursday 20 January 1949, Leonard Constance was sold by St. Helens to Dewsbury for £2000 (based on increases in average earnings, this would be approximately £162,900 in 2013) along with <a href="Harry%20Street%20%28rugby%20league%29">Harry Street</a> who was sold for £1000, the £3000 raised, contributed to the £4000 St. Helens paid <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Belle Vue Rangers</a> for <a href="Stan%20McCormick">Stan McCormick</a>, Constance made his début for Wakefield Trinity during September 1952.
Coaching career.
Club career.
Len Constance was the <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a> of <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> from Tuesday 10 July 1951, until 21-days later when he placed himself on the <a href="Transfer%20market%23Transfer%20list">transfer list</a> on Tuesday 31 July 1951, shortly after this he joined <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> (as did fellow Dewsbury player; <a href="Harry%20Street%20%28rugby%20league%29">Harry Street</a>) on-or-before Saturday 18 August 1951.
Outside of rugby.
Leonard Constance taught at <a href="Rivington%20Road%20School">Rivington Road School</a> in <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a>, where another Welsh <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> player, <a href="Don%20Gullick">Don Gullick</a> also taught
Genealogical information.
Leonard Constance's marriage to Elsie B. (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Nixon) (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DmeoSbO7vw5asVuzUkBwiaQ%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> second ¼ 1927 in <a href="Prescot">Prescot</a> district) was registered during fourth ¼ 1948 in <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> district, they had children; Susan H. Constance (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D9nzBtkFKHg0DCQGxgX3qRQ%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> third ¼ in <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> district), Gillian K. R. Constance (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DO5TT8M6j2ImOBDNnp3tdBw%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> first ¼ in St.Helens district), and Michael S. Constance (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DIIF8K4Ew7tSiKfWPPe8icw%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> second ¼ in <a href="Pontypool">Pontypool</a> district).
